Header: Fashion designers inspired by traditional Chinese elements at China Fashion Week
Content: Chinese elements lit up the China International Fashion Week, in Beijing. Inspired by the Liangzhu culture, a Neolithic jade culture that existed between 3300 BC until 2300 BC in the Yangtze River Delta region of China, designers used the traditional patterns from jade and pottery with their costume designs. Traditional Chinese architectural elements also inspired designs, amazing the audience with its use of bright colors and vitality generated by the ancient elements. In addition, a special children’s show with the theme “Fairy Tale Town” was featured at the fashion week.
